result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Gray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard Gray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Richard Gray in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 2015CF4013 for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Richard Gray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Richard Gray in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Discussion regarding defendant's newer pending case 15CF4013. State intends this matter to be dismissed and read in for purposes of a global resolution with the defendant's new case on the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on September 2, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed

Defendant Richard Gray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. State advised the Court he may be filing additional charges in this case and requested an adjourned plea date to complete further investigation. Court granted State's request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on August 14, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Richard Gray not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. State advised the Court they will be filing additional charges against the defendant and request an adjourned date. Defense does not object. Court granted the State's request for adjournment. State will do an OTP for the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Richard Gray not in court, in custody.  Attorney Wesson advised parties via e-mail that he was unable to appear on today's date as he was out of the office.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Case continued before Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Richard Gray not in court, in custody.  
Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court of Plea hearing.  Parties seeking new date.  State to file additional charges in the near future.  Joint motion to adjourn granted by the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Richard Gray not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Parties had previously selected 5/28/15 at 1:30 p.m. for scheduling.  CCAP updated.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Richard Gray not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date; defendant may be facing possible new charges.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Richard Gray not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties request another scheduling date; defendant facing new charges.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Gray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Richard Gray in custody.  Ann Lopez for Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KOURTNEY M. AND SEAWAY BANK AND TRUST COMPANY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Richard Gray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Richard Gray in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
